Description: Large fragment, one side of a cloth, possibly a long tunic in warp-faced plain weave. The wear is worst at the half-way point of the extant object, presumably reused as a mummy wrapping. The fine quality, undyed linen now greyish beige. Very worn with repairs/darning in two places; traces of resin. One plain selvedge with original horizontal edges lost. Warp is s-spin, s-spiced with c. 52 ends per cm; weft is s-spin, s-spiced, c. 22 picks per cm. The darning thread is s-spin, s-spliced, at mid-point, a later layer of darning over the earlier one hitches in both directions. At the second spot, a tear closed with oversewing with a hitched thread crossing.
